choices: Earth sized world - Inhabitants can be from 1ft up to 100ft.
Gas Giant - Inhabitants range from 1,000 feet up to 500 miles in height.
Brown Dwarf - Inhabitants range in height from 1,000 miles to 100,000 miles.
Asteroid - Inhabitants have a maximum height of 1ft and no minimum.
Other (worlds which are unique and do not fit in the above categories)
1.content:
20 million years in the future humanity has colonized the entire universe and has genetically modified itself to be able to inhabit every planet, moon, and asteroid as efficiently as possible. Those who lived on enormous gas giants had to be grown to miles in stature in order to be able to withstand the enormous gravity of these plants; while those who colonized tiny asteroids had to be altered to microscopic proportions in order to eke out an existence on such a small rock.

For some unknown reason, a rift has also occurred between the genders. With cloning now the sole method of procreation, males and females decided they no longer needed each other and fought a bitter war on many of the planets in the universe. On some planets, the males prevailed, while on other worlds it was the female gender. The vanquished gender was then ethnically cleansed or enslaved by the dominant gender. Over time the conflict began to spread out into space, as each gender sought to conquer the entire universe for itself.

The universe is a vast battlefield full of numberless individuals from each gender. Where shall our story begin? Keep in mind the mass of the planet also determines the size of its inhabitants. This is just a starting point.
1.title: 20 million years in the future...

choices: Terra Novus - Male controlled Earth planet. Inhabitants average 5ft in height.
Nova New York - Gender neutral Super-Earth. Inhabitants average 75ft tall.
Aphroditia II - Female dominated Earth planet. Inhabitants average 7ft tall.
Tzugran Prime - Homeworld of a non-human alien species. Average height 50ft.
More Choices (you decide)
11.content:
"Earth sized" worlds refers to worlds which have a similar mass to that of Earth, and which a human of normal height would be able to stand without either floating off into space or being crushed under the enormous gravity. This doesn't mean a human of normal height would necessarily be comfortable at either extreme, but at least the conditions would be tolerable.

There are countless billions of these worlds in the universe, so these are but a handful. If you want, you are free to create other worlds, but keep in mind the inhabitants of these worlds can be no smaller than 1ft and no larger than 100ft.
11.title: Earth sized world - Inhabitants can be from 1ft...

choices: Start here
Nah, something else, please...
113.content:
Aphroditia II is a fairly peaceful place as planets go: few predators have evolved that can pose a threat to humans, the weather is nice, and there is little conflict over it. Overall, the climate of Aphroditia II is almost identical to that of Earth's Mediterranean region during the summer. Here, women rule, but males are tolerated-a very rare event in the galaxy. (Cloning is still used here, men are mainly used for sexual satisfaction) Generally, women grow to around 7 feet tall, but 8, 9, or even 10-foot tall women are possible. The typical woman here has a large set of breasts, typically H or I, a large butt to match, and is strong enough to lift an Earth rhino. Males, on the other hand, have shrunk: the average man is only around 3 feet in height, but penis sizes average out to be almost 12 inches. Given the warm climate, people almost never wear clothes.
Aphroditia II's geography is one of many small inland seas fed by rivers, with hilly ridges, open plains, and large forests being the main types of terrain. Settlements are scattered throughout the planet, but they are the exception, rather than the norm: the typical Aphroditian lives either alone or with one or two close friends, usually with one male shared among them for sexual needs. Of the two, living alone is usually the path taken by most Aphroditians, in small houses built out of wood from felled trees.
The plant animal life on Aphroditia II are also strange: it's all from Earth. This planet was terraformed several centuries ago to simulate the Mediterranean islands, and flora and fauna from this area was used to populate the planet, including recently extinct species. As a result, dwarf elephants, wild boar, fallow deer, pygmy hippos, red foxes, and so forth fill in the animal portion of the planet, while oak, olive, cedar, pine trees, etc. fill in the plant portion.
Males are treated reasonably well, and mistreating one is frowned upon, but men are still considered inferior. Most men rarely leave their mate's bedroom, often doing small chores around the house, such as washing dishes, cooking food, and cleaning the house.
All in all, though, Aphroditia II is quite a nice place. But is it what you want?
113.title: Aphroditia II - Female dominated Earth planet. ...

choices: Choices
More Choices
Even More Choices!
115.content: The universe is nearly infinite...
115.title: More Choices (you decide)

choices: Jupiter - Gender neutral gas giant within the very Solar system. 300 Miles tall.
Omegulon VII - Male dominated Gas Giant. Inhabitants average 40 miles tall.
Sapnejtor - Homeworld of a non-Human Alien species. 5,000 ft tall.
Estrogenia II - Female dominated gas giant. Inhabitants average 200 miles tall.
More Choices (create your own custom gas giant)
12.content:
Gas Giants are the largest planets, but can vary considerably in mass from about 10 times larger than Earth, such as Neptune, to thousands of times larger such as Jupiter and beyond. Gas Giants tend to be a very hostile environment with violent storms and extreme temperatures. Survival on such massive worlds requires humans to be altered to equally massive proportions.

Here are but a few examples.
12.title: Gas Giant - Inhabitants range from 1,000 feet u...

choices: More Choices
More More Choices
More More More Choices
125.content: If you didn't like any of the default choices I provided, here's your opportunity to create your very own gas giant world.
125.title: More Choices (create your own custom gas giant)

choices: Alpha Amazonia - Largest female faction in the universe. 88,000 miles height.
Malus Andronia - Largest male faction in the universe. 76,000 miles height.
Humania Pacifica - Largest mixed gender faction in the universe. 65k miles tall.
Jevula Prime - Largest non-human race in the universe. 48,000 miles height.
More Choices (you decide)
13.content:
(Admittedly, this is not a very realistic set of options, but if I were to accept only what is realistic then this entire interactive wouldn't have been created, so here we are.)

Brown Dwarfs are something more than a gas giant, but less than a star. The crushing mass of these behemoths is so powerful that those hardy individuals who choose to call these worlds home have been forced to enlarge themselves to extremely massive proportions. In fact, the men and women who live on brown dwarfs each have the mass of a planet in their own right, and could in theory hold their own atmospheres, oceans, and populations of billions.

Fortunately, the Brown Dwarfians consider most other worlds too small and insignificant to be worthy of their time. Sadly, a Brown Dwarfian male or female will occasionally amuse themselves by conquering, toying with, or outright destroying an Earth world (or smaller), though these events are somewhat rare. They do, however, find Gas Giant worlds as attractive prey, and thus the epic battles between them and the Gas Giantians are legendary throughout the universe.
13.title: Brown Dwarf - Inhabitants range in height from ...

choices: Continue with her usual routine and take a quick bath.
Meet with her friend and bodyguard, Freya.
Go to speak with her mother, the Queen.
131.content:
Alpha Amazonia's slow rotation was just bringing its eastern hemisphere into the sight of its companion star, its golden light filtering through the jade-green leaves of the towering, spindly warden trees, falling through a turquoise tinted diamond window on the east end of the royal palace. The shafts of light hung in the air, and the advancing day slowly brought them to the foot of a bed, and began to trace them up the body of Princess Aquaelie.

The inching light that started at her feet took a half hour to reach finally illuminate her face; slowly brightening the lithe, supple features of a young woman engineered over a million years to be the epitome of grace. The light sparkled from her pale skin in silvery whorls of intricate body markings, made up not of metallic ink by the protruding towers, tunnels and landing pads of an entire civilization. As the Queen's youngest daughter, no expense could be spared in Aquaelie's defense, inside or out, and colonists from Aphroditia II had been convinced to settle within her body, supplanting its natural functions with an industry and defense tens of billions of women strong. If the infrastructure needed to mark her skin were cities and foundries on awe-inspiring scale, to Aquaelie, as she stirred in the morning light, they were visible only as a slight metallic accent all along her body in pleasing designs.

Yawning briefly, she slipped her legs from the bed and got to her feet, stretching out to her full height, her slim, naked form stretching from head to toe just a smidge over ninety-thousand standard miles. As she glanced out the windows at the world-dwarfing crystal spires and gorgeous gardens of her homeworld, the Princess' Violet eyes sparkled with enthusiasm as a smile curled her lips.

She came of age today, and would finally be allowed to leave the world of her birth at will. She turned from the window and marched across the room, her velvet hair fanning in an arc about her before settling behind her to the small of her back.

Today was the day she'd anticipated all her life, but she shouldn't rush things. First things first; Aquaelie should probably...
131.title: Today's the Day.

choices: "...no, I don't need anything more today."
"...perhaps if you could fetch me some...toys?"
"...Yes, I require your assistance bathing."
1311.content:
As she exited her room and slipped into the washroom behind it, Aquaelie could already hear the sound of water pouring into the bath. She loved a nice hot bath in the morning, even if strictly speaking it was a pointless exercise. The people who called her body home were quite capable of running such maintenance, and during the day she knew "massive" starships would be casually orbiting any part of her body, intercepting debris before it could dirty her royal form, and scraping it away with military-grade beam weapons if it did.

So her baths were merely a luxury, one impossible for the unfortunates not of Alpha-Amazonian descent. The crystal-clear bath was over-large even by her standards, and the amount of water needed to fill it could have supplied the oceans of untold worlds. Slipping gracefully into the water, she gave a groan of delight, relaxing back and closing her eyes for a moment.

Footsteps caught her attention, as she glanced aside to see the slight form of a red-haired, freckled woman. Each lineage of Alpazonians had been developed to accent some aspect of femininity foremost. If the tall, lithe form of Aquaelie accentuated an ultimate grace, then the petite, nigh spritely form of the lower class girl accentuated a demurity expected of her role.

Clad in a shimmering blue rube, like all clothing composed of strands of diamond fiber, the girl knelt and placed a tray of wafers and glass of wine at the edge of the bath. Her Princess gave a small nod of acknowledgement, her long fingers picking up one of the little treats to take a dainty bite. Much like bathing, eating was not entirely necessary. The industry that existed within her body powered it by means of fusion plants, tiny contained stars that existed spread throughout her body. Their ability to recycle for her was astounding, and precluded anything so unladylike on Aquaelie's part as excreting waste.

So the treats she so enjoyed were made mostly of metals and sugars; those things needed to keep her population alive and productive. The wine, on the other hand, was pure indulgence, several zetta-gallons of liquid passing through her lips just for the simple pleasure. It was thoughts like this that made her feel good. Some Alphazonians lived their lives as if they were normal, and the universe were small. But Aquaelie took immense satisfaction in knowing her true scale.

"Would there be anything else, Mistress?" The red-headed servant asked.

Turning her head to regard the woman, the Princess raised an eyebrow, her musical soprano saying...
1311.title: A Relaxing Start.

choices: "...so let's set out as soon as possible!"
"...but why don't we head around town a bit first?"
"...but, I really want to spend a little time with you right now."
1312.content:
Today was a special day indeed, and Aquaelie could forgo a bit of her usual morning luxuries. The first thing that came to mind was to speak to her friend Freya, and discuss just what they would do with her new found freedom. She stepped quickly over to her wardrobe, opening it to sift through her more casual garments. She picked out a short, backless white dress, complemented with a ever-so-light sleeveless purple jacket with waist-length tassels running from it's shoulders. She then slipped on a pair of knee-high, high-heeled boots to match the dress, and elbow-length sequined gloves matching the jacket.

Fully dressed she closed the wardrobe and made her way through the door and into the palace proper, each motion economical, perfectly graceful and poised as befit the proper image of a princess. It was only a short jaunt down the hallways of milky white crystal to Freya's quarters, her long-time bodyguard not permitted to stray too far from her presence.

It could well have been the ca-clack of her heels echoing down the hall that roused the other woman, but as she arrived to find Freya already waiting at the door, Aquaelie knew better than to doubt her timing.

Each lineage of Alphazonia was dedicated to an aspect of Feminity. The ruling house, and Aquaelie, were immaculately designed to be graceful. Their servants, Demure. Freya...embodied endurance, and perseverance, the most important aspects of a proper warrior. The loose-fitting navy blue pants she wore could conceal her legs and hips. Conversely the tight garment of the same color that circled her upper body, baring her midriff, arms and shoulders, left nothing to the imagination, be that the swell of her sizeable breasts or the smooth lines of her developed arms and abs.

"M'lady," she said with a sincere smile, giving a slight bow to Aquaelie before standing to her full height once again to look down at her, deep green eyes sparkling. Generally it would have been unseemly for another line to have the audacity to be taller than a royal, but even by the Alphazonian standards, Freya was an amazon at nearly a hundred and five thousand miles tall. But then no expense was spared, in protection of the Queen's darling youngest daughter, and there was no being in existence, let alone even the largest lowly man, who could contemplate physically challenging Freya.

"Freya," Aquaelie responded in proper fashion, giving a slight nod of acknowledgement as her slim form slipped past her towering bodyguard and into her room. As Freya stepped in behind her and closed the door, Aquaelie took a moment to look around, admiring the things she had collected on her trips away. There was a shelf on one wall where rested the disabled hulls of enemy warships, and even a globe on her desk that the princess knew was no mere navigational instrument but yet another spoil of war. The thought that soon she would be the one travelling the stars, taking prizes and conquering worlds, threatened to break her princessly composure.

Of course, what she didn't break herself, Freya was happy to do for her. "Congratulations, 'Elie!" The woman said excitedly now that they were out of public view, putting her arms around the princess from behind and lifting her in a brief but heartfelt hug, her snow white hair mingling with the blue-black of her charge's for a moment before she set her back down and stepped away. "I know how much today means to you...so I've already gotten us cleared to leave whenever. Her Highness recognizes how excited you must be, and said she wouldn't keep you."

"That's wonderful!" 'Elie responded with a broad smile, taking a seat in one of the large, comfortable chairs scattered about Freya's room, "I mean, it's really hard to believe that I can finally...well, go, you know?"

"I do know. I remember how excited I was..." Freya chcukled, "Well, that was only a few years past though," she said as she looked around her room pridefully, "just imagine what sort of things you and I can bring back in another four years."

"Yeah Frey, I just can't wait to get started," Aquaelie responded...
1312.title: Alpha Alpha Amazon.

choices: Aboard one of the luxurious, yacht-like shuttles.
Using one of the hyperspace travel-packs.
13121.content:
"Hah, well if that's how you feel," Freya agrees with a smile, watching as 'Elie pulled herself up from the chair once more.

Taking only a moment to collect her sidearm, Freya falls in line to the side and a few steps behind the princess, her "proper," position, as the two of them make their way through the all but empty halls towards the Palace's garage, passing only the occasional servant or solider on the way. The gorgeous crystal hallways, lined with works of art and trophies of war, slowly give way to more subdued construction; though still made of the same diamond-like substance.

As they arrive there are a few of the "small" ships belonging the royal family still parked in their respective places, while along one wall a large number of jetpack-looking apparatuses hung in neatly ordered rows.

"What do you think, M'lady. Would you prefer to take one of the ships?" Freya asked.

Aquaelie considered that for a moment. The vessels themselves were relatively cramped affairs, though these were down right palatial compared to other enclosed craft her people used, and carried all the amenities of home.

On the other hand, the lift-packs small size made them even quicker, and there was a certain appeal to flying free of any enclosure with the solar winds in her hair, nothing between her, the stars, and her soon-to-be subjects.

In the end, Aquaelie decides to take her first jaunt away from home...
13121.title: Departing.

choices: She approaches Geordia
She finds smaller planets
She goes to a Gas Giant first,
131212.content:
Aquaelie decided to go with the hyperspace travel-packs, she wanted to get up close and personal with some Earth sized worlds. Her people already disregard the smaller and tiny humans as inferior sub-humans, and her world was the only one of it's size in this galaxy, and there aren't many Gas Giants nearby either. Her people were the Gods of the Galaxy and she was the Princess of the Gods, so her planet held no treaty agreements with any planet, as they had all the power. There were even some Earth sized words unaware of people so unimaginably huge as Aquaelie is, and they'll be in for a shock.


One of those was the planet Geordia, a planet dominated by Chauvinistic men, a system akin to old Eaths 17th Century, the men regard the women as inferior beings only fit for giving birth, so they were in for a shock that their demise will come in the form of a humongous women larger than their planet, their planet was only 6500 miles (10461 km) in diameter in size so just a small 12cm to

Aquaelie has always dreamed of eating an entire planet, in 1 bite, but she may as hello select a planet just large enough to play around with first.
131212.title: Using one of the hyperspace travel-packs.

choices: The Lord and Lady of Humania Pacifica
A Hum-Pac miner operating in hostile territory
A tiny refugee who has sought refuge from male or female oppression
133.content:
Although almost the entire human race has divided into mutually hostile genders throughout the galaxy, for various reasons there were the occasional exceptions. The vast distances between the stars kept many worlds in isolation, and over the course of millions of years many developed along diverging paths of social and even biological evolution. Not every planet embraced cloning and the schism of the genders. Some continued to practice the ancient methods of sexual reproduction, and on these worlds the male and female genders lived together in peace and harmony, and did their best to maintain neutrality as their sisters and brothers fought against one another in the stars.

Such is the tale of Humania Pacifica, a massive Brown Dwarf in orbit of a binary star in a relatively isolated region of the Andromeda Galaxy. Humania Pacifica was among the very first Brown Dwarves colonized by Humanity millions of years ago, back before the great schism occurred and humans had first mastered the massive biological altering required to endure the severe conditions of Brown dwarf worlds.

Due to their relative isolation, the inhabitants of Humania Pacifica were spared from most of the propaganda by the male and female factions who sought to instigate revolts and lure the planet over to their side. Another factor which worked in their favor was the sheer enormity of the people. At an average height of 65,000 miles tall, each inhabitant in their own right was larger than most planets! Even among Brown Dwarfians, there were very few who even came close to this size, and fewer still who managed to exceed it. Thus far every invasion force sent against them by male or female factions has been easily and decisively crushed.

The Humania-Pacificans (or Hum-Pacs for short), take great pride in their neutrality and independence, and view themselves as the protectors of all Mixed-Gender planets throughout the universe. Although the Hum-Pacs tend to be isolationists and generally seldom venture far beyond their star system, they do welcome Mixed-Gender refugees from across the universe, and so the Humania Pacifica star system is home to countless space ships of various origins. The size of these ships varies based on the size of their occupants; some spaceships are as large as planets, while some are as tiny as specks of dust. None however are as large as the ships manned by the Hum-Pacs themselves.

Hum-Pac starships are extremely massive and tend to hold a crew of only one or two with almost no exceptions. This is because it may require an entire star system worth of raw materials just to construct such a vessel. This means billions (if not even trillions) of smaller beings must be robbed of their homeworlds just to create a starship for a single Hum-Pac man or woman. In times past Hum-Pac miners routinely stripped star systems clean of all raw materials, and wiped out untold trillions of smaller beings in the process, leaving only lone stars void of all planets within a radius of many parsecs.

Since then, new laws have been passed which forbid the wanton genocide of smaller civilizations. Nowadays, Hum-Pac mining operations require that the indigenous civilizations be gently removed from the planet and placed in a protected reservation as the planet is harvested and smelted down into usable ores. Afterwards, after the starship is completed, the indigenous civilization is grafted to the livable interior of the starship either as a non-functional part of the decor, or in some cases as functioning crew to help with the maintenance and operation of the starship that was once their homeworld. Some Hum-Pacs have protested this as legalized slavery, but proponents defend the practice as necessary, and certainly more humane than the outright genocide that occurred in ages past.

Now that we have a good deal established about the background of Humania Pacifica, whom will we follow from this point onwards?
133.title: Humania Pacifica

choices: They really were the colonists of Jevula Prime!
Some unknown alien race of humanoid appearance!
Some unknown alien race of a very bizarre and non-humanoid appearance!
134.content:
Although the human race have become the most powerful and dominant species throughout the known universe, they are far from the only species. Over the millions of years since humanity first set off into the stars there have been countless inter-species wars, conquests, and sadly in most cases these ended in slavery and genocide of the less technologically advanced native species. However, from time to time humanity encountered a species they could not conquer, and one such example were the Jevulans.

When humans first arrived in the Jevulan system they found numerous planets, including a massive brown dwarf in orbit of a red giant sun. The smaller planets were soon colonized, as humanity had done with similar planets for thousands of years, but the expedition of colonists sent to Jevula Prime vanished without a trace. Although scans had detected no signs of life, it was clear that someone (or something) had killed the colonists.

Years passed by, and humans living on the other worlds of the Jevula system wrote off the massive Brown Dwarf that dominated the heavens as a cursed world, and no further attempts were made at colonization. This would have been the end of the story, but for the strange reappearance of the massive landing craft that had been used by the disappearing colonists. They had survived after all! Or so it seemed...

The human inhabitants of Jevula II, a moderate sized world, screamed in terror as the landing craft nearly equal in size to their entire world touched down and flattened an entire hemisphere deep into the mantle of a planet much to small to accommodate a landing craft of this immense size. Millions were instantly killed, and entire cities were wiped out of all existence in the blink of an eye. This sudden near doubling of the planet's mass severely altered the planet's rotation as well as greatly increasing its mass, which had the effect of nearly doubling the gravitational pull of those who were fortunate enough to be on the opposite hemisphere of where the ship had landed. This effect, although not immediately fatal, meant that an individual who normally weighed 200 pounds now weighed 400 pounds, and so on.

Those who survived were horrified by this sudden annihilation of so many people, and couldn't help but wonder why the colonists of Jevula Prime would do such a thing, especially after having disappeared for so many years without a trace. As the doors of the spaceship opened at last, two beings of unimaginably gargantuan proportions stepped out and towered like colossus over what remained of Jevula II.

These gargantuan beings...
134.title: Jevula Prime

choices: More Choices
More Choices
More Choices.... dun dun dun
135.content: Which of these choices will you choose to choice?
135.title: More Choices (you decide)

choices: Ceres - Large gender neutral asteroid not far from Earth. Average height 7".
Micro-Sparta - Highly militaristic male dominated Asteroid. Average height 1".
Lesbiputia - Softball sized female controlled Asteroid. Average height 0.03 mm.
Oxnotia - Asteroid homeworld of a non-human alien race. Average height 2".
More Choices (you decide)
14.content:
Asteroids are less than planets. They have little or no atmosphere, which makes artificial habitats a must. Since they are so tiny, for them to support any meaningful population the inhabitants must be altered to be proportionally small. Because the dwellers of Asteroids are so small, they are extremely vulnerable to the aggression of larger worlds. Fortunately, Asteroids are so tiny and inconsequential that the largest people tend to ignore them and leave them alone, but there is always the sad exception of billions of asteroid inhabitants being wiped out or enslaved by an infinitely larger enemy just for the hell of it...

There are countless trillions of asteroids in the universe, so these are but a handful. If you want, you are free to create other inhabited asteroids, but keep in mind the inhabitants of these no larger than 1ft, but you can make them as small as you like (in proportion to the size of the asteroid).
14.title: Asteroid - Inhabitants have a maximum height of...

choices: A diplomat negotiating for Sparta
A vanguard scouting out a female world
A Hoplon on campaign
142.content:
Micro-Sparta was only called such by the few civilizations who knew the asteroid existed, the natives simply called it Sparta, mostly due to ego and what they say about men and their infatuation with size and all that stuff. Anyway, life here was regimented and tough by necessity, their immediate neighbors were women that were approximately 4 feet tall on average. Thankfully they weren't aware of Sparta's existence because they'd quickly enslave or exterminate them all quite easily.

Due to their size, they had to deal with a few problems: metal is impossible to work with at their size, clothing is impossible to impractical to make comfortable at their scale (so everyone is naked, warpaint does exist though), their size makes them an easy conquest for anyone more than an inch taller.

In this regimented, militaristic society, there were quite a few jobs that were needed to ensure Sparta's existence: the Diplomat Corps who negotiated the construction of spaceships and weapons since forging metal was incredibly difficult to impractical at their size, the Vanguard who scouted out their neighbors and determined who could be conquered, or should be avoided, and the Hoplon Wall, the average soldier who defended and conquered in the name of the almighty Y chromosome. Even if you were only an inch tall.

So, who are you?
142.title: Micro-Sparta - Highly militaristic male dominat...

choices: Over the top!!! (Charge the microzon lines)
The microzon allies arrive
The microzons charge the spartan line
1423.content:
Sparta was at war, and they were holding the line millimeter by bloody millimeter. Their laser batteries (to someone at 6ft, they'd just be really powerful laser pointers) blinked nonstop at their enemies positions across the yard. Above the defensive line, the brave Spartans flag fluttered in the breeze (you know, that Greek symbol) and they waited for command to send in their next batch of orders, each spartan with the symbol painted on the pair chest and on their forehead, for protection and bravery.

Corporal Mikal was afraid, of course he had the training and had seen his friends killed by the enemy, but he just couldn't shake his fears. He wasn't born the perfect spartan, he was thin, not too strong, the only thing that made his people accept him was his unwavering determination to follow his orders or die trying. So far it'd worked out quite well.

But now they'd gotten word from the Vanguard that the Microzons (tiny amazons) had managed to get help from some much, much larger women, and there was no way any of the spartan allies could arrive in time to help. And Spartans never retreat, or surrender.

He looked over the defensive wall, watching as their laser batteries caused a microzon to fall over screaming as she burst into flame from the concentrated power of the laser. They'd have to cross that field, those deadly 34 inches of open ground to the microzon line and fight hand to hand. He double checked his spear, really it was just a particularly long thorn from a native plant, but to them, it was a spear. Soon, they'd have to fight, and hope to win the war before their enemies allies arrived.
1423.title: A Hoplon on campaign

choices: The giantesses turn on the microzons too
The microzons and giantesses torture the Spartans
14232.content:
A meeting had been called by command, and Mikal was kneeling around their commander as he spoke to the assembled troops around him. "I will not lie gentlemen, it looks bleak." He sighed, brushing his hair back before continuing, "Vanguard reports indicate that the Microzon allies have arrived in orbit and are descending as we speak, we cannot hold our positions. High command has withdrawn from the system, leaving us with a standing order to resist by all ameans until relieved." He looke duo a team the sky, as though expecting to see the female starships arriving, "What that means is; we take to the forests and rocks and fight as guerrillas. We will survive! Prepare to evac!"

As the Spartan lines began to grab whatever supplies they could, Mikal made sure he had his spear, not wanting to be caught without it, when he felt the ground shake.

THOOOM

"Giantess! Fifty feet! Move men, MOVE!!" The commander yelled rom somewhere, and Mikal didn't wait to see from where. He took off running into the thrash, hoping to make it to the trees just a few yard away form the trenches.

Looking up, he saw a massive foot come down and scurry their entire artillery line, the Microzons charging the failing Spartan line. A few artillery men managed to get their cannons blinking at the microzons, but otherwise it was a complete rout. The giants towered countless feet above the original tiny combatants of this planetoid, at least 20 feet tall, maybe a bit more by Mikals estimations.

Managing to make it to the tree, Mikal started climbing up the bark until he found a nook in the craggy material, and wedged himself in there, waiting until nightfall to move t a better location.
14232.title: The microzon allies arrive

choices: Choice #1
Choice #2
Choice #3
145.content: You spin the wheel of choices and the choice that the wheel chose is....
145.title: More Choices (you decide)

choices: We follow a group of tiny undesirable humans leaving Eden?
We stay with Eden?
We follow the 6 ft tall giants from a nearby Earth like planet?
1451.content:
New Eden is an unusual asteroid that is around hundred miles wide, and it is shaped like a nearly perfect sphere. The surface of this miniature moon or minor planet is just Earth like. There are small lakes, small oceans, rivers, small mountains, and even small continents all over this dwarf planet. Their mountains would be considered decent size hills on Earth, and their continents would be considered small islands, while their seas would be as large as a good size lake on Earth. It would take a normal size human that is around six feet tall, about a day to walk around the entire world.

The atmosphere of this small world is thick, but small, and very Earth like. There are several small cities and towns all over the planet, some above ground, and most are safely underground. A large, powerful matter, anti matter engine is at its core, generating a strong magnetic field all over Eden, and it keeps the miniature world warm in space, regardless of where it is. It generates a strong force field that keeps the atmosphere in, and most invaders out. It also provides power to all of the small world’s cities, the world’s defenses, and even the asteroids small spacecraft that can leave Eden when needed.

Eden orbits a yellow dwarf star similar to that of Earth’s sun Sol, but Eden’s sun is much smaller. Unlike other worlds, this small world can leave, and go elsewhere if it has too, because it has two powerful engines that are located on its two poles. The planet has a thick rocky crust, and all of its water is fresh, not salty. Miniature lush green plants of various types cover most of its surface as well as miniature animals, and humans. The unusually attractive miniature humans of Eden are all around 3 inches, or 7.6 cm tall, depending on their age, and gender. The population of this tiny world is Caucasian, White. They are a religious, conservative culture where both genders share almost equal power, with the males having a slight edge. They still speak English, and they have a weird, constitutional parliamentary form of government. They have a Prime Minster, a Senate, and a Lower House.

They have a police force, and a respectable military. Small defensive satellites orbit, and protect their world too. In addition, various kinds of military space ships, space fighters, tanks, and other types of equipment protect Eden. They even have miniature nova bombs, and small black hole mines, which are powerful enough to destroy an attacking force from even a brown dwarf star. Because of their defensive stance, very few have ever attempted to invade these tiny, but impressive people, and their world Eden is thrived for millions of years.

However, space on this small world is limited, and overpopulation is a problem, so occasionally, so-called volunteers are forced to leave New Eden for an unknown fate. These tiny, undesirable humans are placed in a nice, long-range shuttle-craft, and are sent off to the nearest Earth size world, or asteroid size world that is within range. Before we go on, whom do we follow?

Feel free to add, and yes, Eden can be raided with the right strategy.
1451.title: New Eden, an Unusual Asteroid!

choices: They are heading to an Earth like planet, where people are around 5 ft tall?
A large alien ship is heading for them? The aliens are around 5 feet tall?
14511.content:
As the Asteroid world of New Eden or Eden for short slowly orbits its star, a deportation ceremony is underway. Surrounded by hundreds of heavily armed troops that are dressed in green camouflage, twenty-five unlucky people, mostly females are boarding a nice space shuttle. The public felt that if these people have to leave their world, and most likely face some kind of horrible fate, then at the very least their shuttle should be pleasant to live. As the undesirables board the shuttle-craft, a bureaucrat is standing on a nearby stage, giving a bull crap speech about self-sacrifice to a large, naive civilian crowed, and the public bought it.

The shuttle is the size of a 1950’s DC-10 passenger airplane, but it looks more like a large ocean going fishing vessel. This light colored ship has no pilot, it is run entirely by computer, and it is completely automated, with few defenses if any. There is no crew on board, just some robots, and the ship’s main computer. As the twenty-five reluctant passengers sit in their seats, the shuttle-craft lifts off and leaves Eden, never to return.

Now moving through space, away from Eden at three times the speed of light, or warp 3, the passengers who are the only humans on board, get out of their seats and have a look around. The passengers look out of a window, and see…
14511.title: A tiny, undesirable group of refuges?

choices: Areola, a warrior of the amazons
Xxcka, a hunter of the beetles
Ubera, spoiled princess of the amazons
1452.content:
On the small asteroid of Tinyscira, the 1/2" Amazons lived in, not peace, but not total war either, the Amazonian natives have to contend with the viscous native life forms. The Asteroid is a hair over 2,400 square feet in size, and the amazon lifestyle is not what was idealized 20 million years ago. In addition to having to deal with masculine invaders every couple decades or so, at their scale forging metal is impossible, and to top it off, they aren't the only civilization on the rock.

A race of beetle-like aliens, about 1.5" inches in size, called this rock first, and they've been enslaving and killing the amazons wherever they met on the fields of the asteroid. Of course, a blade of grass is a tee to these people, so make of that what you will when we say fields.

Now, who are you?
1452.title: Tinyscira: Land of Ant-Sized Amazons!

choices: Going after a beetle camp in the area
Men have been spotted on the surface
14521.content:
Several inches underground, in a hive city of the amazons, Areola woke up in her den, the dug out hole in the wall serving as her quarters, and stretched, popping her arms and legs as she did so. Standing up, she looked out into the common area, the glowing fungus of the underground hive illuminating the area well. Hopping out onto the ground, she noticed that her body paint had faded, she'd need to reapply it later, but first she needed to eat.

"Areola! Come, the morning feast begins!" Her companion, Vulva said with cheer, her bare breasts rubbing against her back as she was hugged from behind. Clothing was impractical to make a team their size, and was culturally unknown to them.

"Vulva, how many times have I said to leave me be?" Areola said with a groan, shoving her friends arms off her.

Vulva, meanwhile, smiled at her annoyed friend, 'I don't know, but come on! Or else we'll be getting leftovers!"

Arellano smiled and hunkered her friend, and she did have to agree with her on one thing, food was best eaten fresh, and not a day or two old. Seemed like the hunters had gotten lucky, a whole mouse had been captured!

Grabbing a chunk of mouse meat, Areola and her friend sat down and began discussing their plans for the day.
14521.title: Areola, a warrior of the amazons

154.title: Space debris (hull of a wrecked ship, a wine bo...

choices: "...Lilly Hedge, Chief Scientist."
"...Kyle Dumont, Chief Flight Officer."
"...Angela Koste, Head of Security."
1541.content:
A row of dim lights slowly flicker to life in the darkness, illuminating, if barely, thee pristine white corridors of what little remains of Manifest Destiny, what had been a colony ship during humanities golden age. An unknown calamity had put an end to that, and the vessel's shattered hull has drifted in a slow circuit of the galactic core long enough for galactic civilization to rise and fall at least three times.

Deep inside the forward section of the ship, as lights and artificial gravity slowly start to come back online, so do other systems. The emergency stasis tanks in the crew compartent thrum with energy, and at least one of them creaks open slowly.

"Greetings," the ships AI chimes in a helpful tone, "Elapsed time since stasis activation has been eight-million-three-hundred-fourty-six-thousand-nine-hundred and four years, sixty eight days, and some other time aside from that," it finishes in a suddenly bored feminine voice.

As the pods occupant steps clear, a small laser node in the cieling scans across them, prompting the AI to respond, "Let's see, subject is..."
1541.title: Rise and Shine

choices: ...Every other stasis capsule's alert light glows an angry red.
...One or two of the other capsules display a green ready lamp.
15413.content:
"...and a pleasure it is to hvave you back, Miss Koste," The AI continues unabated, "Enjoy your nap?"

"Shove it, Aea," the awakening woman shot groggily at the computer, slipping out of the stasis tube more fully and planting her boots firmly on the decksole, a hand rising up to smooth out the short fuzz of dark hair atop her head as she shook the sleep out of herself with easy practice, "Now what's this about eight million something-or-others."

"Years. Give or take," The computer elaborated again, "It's taken us that long to drift near enough to anything to bother waking you up. What can I say, space is big."

Biting her lip and adjusting her off-white uniform, Angela sighed and looked around the compartment, "Anyone else make it that long?" She asks, but can clearly see...
15413.title: "...Angela Koste, Head of Security."

choices: "Not much beyond basic emergency gear."
"Well..."
154131.content:
"I'm Sorry Angela," Aea says as she notices the security officers eyebrows droop, "The other modules didn't have time to cycle before the first power surge and...well, that's that."

Sighing, the unformed woman leaned back against her now closed capsule and crossed her arms as she contemplated. "And...the state of the cargo?"

"Lost, along with the entire aft section of the ship." Aea responded dispassionately, and Angela couldn't help but wince at that. Some ten billion stasis-frozen passengers had been miniaturized and stored in the aft sections of the Manifest Destiny, and even if most of them had been cloned to meet the colonization quotas, it was still a mind-numbing figure to think about.

"Did anything else important make it then?" She asked at length.

The computer was silent for a moment before responding.
154131.title: They're Dead Jim

choices: "Take Earth out of stasis. We can at least enlarge a replacement ship."
"Transfer the planet to a travel case, we're getting out of here."
1541312.content:
"...well yes. And I think it might explain why we were attacked to begin with." Aea responded, "if you'd follow the prompts?"

She hadn't finished asking before the passageway out of the room was slightly lit by the turquoise glow of a series of holographic arrows, guiding her through the ship. Her footsteps rang loudly through the deserted vessel, making it feel eerie and dead despite all the elegantly curved structure of the hallways, with their wooden paneling and indirect lighting, could do. In fact the long-dead designers attempt at cheering the ships interior up simply backfired given what Angela had to consider.

Eight million years was a long time indeed. Everyone she'd ever known was dead, along with her entire species for all she knew. Well, or so Aea said; it occurred to her she may just need to search the ship for any misplaced passengers herself. In the meantime she had to admit to being extremely curious just what sort of cargo they must have been carrying to be intercepted as they had been. After all, with their near-monopoly on scaler technology, she hadn't thought there was any other species who would attack a human vessel.

As she drew closer to the armored center of the ship, Angela found herself directed to a small vault-like chamber she didn't recall being in the official deckplan.

"Just what am I looking at, Aea?" She asks, raising an eyebrow as she paced around the large tube in the center of the room.

"Ah well, have a look," Aea said, the holoemitters projecting a tiny, floating woman in circuit-board-patterned uniform who got Angela's attention and directed it to the tube with a little flourish. The armored plating slid away layer by layer, until it revealed...

"That's...but why?" Angela's eyes went wide as she saw the armored stasis tube contained a very familiar blue-green world, the Earth shrunk to the size of a basketball.

"Ah, well we've always had enemies," Aea said with a small shrug, "It just happens that these ones were...more potent than we figured we could deal with."

That sent Angela for a loop, "We can shrink our homeworld down to this, but can't fight off whatever it was?"

"Fifty Fifty," Aea said, "So caution was decided to be the better part of valor. We tried awful hard to keep anybody from finding out on which vessel Earth was being shipped...I guess not hard enough."

"Clearly," The security officer muttered, wondering how many people had even been informed it was to happen before they'd simply been shrunk and locked away.

"Look on the bright side, they're safe, right?" Aea suggested, raising an eyebrow before her hologram flicked back off. "Either way, I think it's about time you started making some decisions. We are still trapped on a floating wreck, you know."

"Alright then," Angela breathed, calming her nerves, "Here's what we'll do."
1541312.title: Precious Cargo

More choices
Let me guess... more choices? Yep!

155.title: More choices (once again, you get to decide)

choices: The perspective of a single void dweller
An encounter with a void dweller from the perspective of a smaller race
The interactions of  a nomadic tribe of void dwellers or something else
1551.content:
There exists subspecies of humanity and aliens that are spoken of in miths and legends. Beings so immense that they are considered celestial bodies unto themselves, the smallest of them rivaling the size of brown dwarfs!
Because of this, they live as entirely space dwelling lifeforms capable of traversing the stars under their own power. The "void dwellers" ,as they are called, have achieved this state of being through transcendental understanding and awareness of the fundamental mechanics and properties of the universe, giving them access to science and abilities far beyond the comprehension of world dwelling lifeforms. As a result, most of the universe regards them as fairy tales.

The void dwellers are nomadic by nature , traveling from galaxy to galaxy at their own pace and never staying in one place for very long.
Void dwellers,as a general rule of thumb, also
Do not have societies in the traditional sense. Infact, most of them live solitary existences,only coming into contact with another of their kind for the sake of reproduction. Though this is the norm for the majority of void dwellers throughout the universe there are still cases where groups of them come together to form nomadic tribal communities.
As to the on going conflict between the genders, most are indifferent, seeing the entire debacle as a collosal waste of time.
Though most void dwellers do not concern themselves with the petty quarrels of world dwellers, some have been known to intervene, either to give their two cents, outright take sides, or to stop warring parties from destroying themselves or their surroundings. Some are speculated to even serve as living Mobile homes for smaller races to live on. Infact, there are entire civilizations that worship them as gods!

The void dwellers are a mighty people indeed and tough they are an incredibly rare sight, the mere presence of one can have far reaching consequences for entire civilizations.

1551321.title: A rare Void Dwelling couple, who even dwarf, Br...

info.brief_description: Millions of years in the future, two human genders must fight for supremacy and survival.
info.description:
20 million years in the future humanity has colonized the entire universe and has genetically modified itself to be able to inhabit every planet, moon, and asteroid as efficiently as possible. Those who lived on enormous gas giants had to be grown to miles in stature in order to be able to withstand the enormous gravity of these plants; while those who colonized tiny asteroids had to be altered to microscopic proportions in order to eke out an existence on such a small rock.

For some unknown reason, a rift has also occurred between the genders. With cloning now the sole method of procreation, males and females decided they no longer needed each other and fought a bitter war on many of the planets in the universe. On some planets, the males prevailed, while on other worlds it was the female gender. The vanquished gender was then ethnically cleansed or enslaved by the dominant gender.

Over time the conflict began to spread out into space, as each gender sought to conquer the entire universe for itself....

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now, as far as rules and such as concerned, I am going to keep that to a bare minimum and have only 2 rules, but these two rules are extremely important.

Rule 1: Do not hijack someone's chapter and take it in a wildly different direction than intended. I cannot stress this enough. If someone is building up to something, do not make an abrupt change. This has happened to me many times in many interactives and it pisses me off. This is why I have to have my own interactive so I can control and get things back on track. If you want to steer a storyline off into another direction do so gradually, and keep options in place so that the previous author can continue on in their intended direction. This way everyone wins. :)

(If you make a chapter and someone hijacks it and steers it off course in a direction you don't like, send me a message and I will edit as necessary. I will try to avoid deleting anything unless there is no other choice.)

Rule 2: Additions must be of a somewhat reasonable level of quality. I don't demand total precision, but I do expect to see the chapters be of a reasonable length and detail and with an acceptable level of grammar. If you can't write at least at a 6th grade level then please don't bother contributing at all. It is better to have no additions at all than worthless ones. Again, I will make edits if I see fit, but I will try to avoid deleting chapters unless they are completely without any merit.

So basically that's it. There's just those two rules. Other than that anything goes. If you want to add something controversial like gay stuff, toilet stuff, incest, or whatever go right ahead. I may not like it personally, but I have no problem allowing it as long as the above rules are followed. I support free speech so I will allow anything, but remember to keep choices in place for others to do their thing as well.
